location.address: Mail Stop 876106, SEMTE, Arizona State University

thesis.title: System Identification and Control Systems Engineering Approaches for Optimal and Practical Personalized mHealth Interventions for Physical Activity

work.name: Interactive Robotics Laboratory, Arizona State University
work.summary: Applied LLMs and MPC in robotic arm control; supervised graduate AI research projects.
highlights: Developed natural-language-driven optimizers using LLMs for robotic task learning
Integrated MPC with LLMs for trajectory planning

work.name: Control Systems Engineering Lab, Arizona State University
work.summary: Developed and applied model-based control in multidisciplinary mHealth interventions.
highlights: Developed predictive models for physical activity interventions (JustWalk JITAI, YourMove, HeartSteps II)
Reduced simulation computation time by over 65% through stochastic search optimization
Created end-to-end automation of intervention delivery systems

work.name: Third Evolution Inc.
work.summary: Process improvement and controls engineering for water treatment plants.
highlights: Improved yield by ~10% and reduced oscillations by 20% through control loop tuning
Wrote SOPs and trained operators, reducing turnaround time by 25%
Ensured full compliance with EPA and safety regulations

publications.name: Model Predictive Control Strategies in mHealth: Optimal Personalized Physical Activity Interventions
System Identification of Engagement in mHealth Intervention with Bayesian Imputation

projects.name: Autonomous Quadcopter Drone Landing
projects.description: Developed and simulated nonlinear control algorithms for quadcopter landing under ground effect using MATLAB/Simulink.

projects.name: Low Carbon Emission SMR Hydrogen Production

projects.name: NEAT Algorithm Implementation
